description: From Middle English sinistre (“unlucky”), from Old French senestre, sinistre (“left”), from Latin sinister (“left hand”).

adjectives.description: sinister (comparative more sinister, superlative most sinister)

entries.meaning: Inauspicious, ominous, unlucky, illegitimate (as in bar sinister).
Evil or seemingly evil; indicating lurking danger or harm.
examples: the sinister atmosphere of the crypt

entries.meaning: (heraldry) On the left side of a shield from the wearer's standpoint, and the right side to the viewer.
(obsolete) Wrong, as springing from indirection or obliquity; perverse; dishonest.
examples: He scorns to undermine another's interest by any sinister or inferior arts.
